author: Namboodiri, M N N and Pramod, S and Shankar, P and Vijayarajan, A K
publisher: Springer Science and Business Media LLC
title: Quasi hyperrigidity and weak peak points for non-commutative operator systems

abstract: A (finite or countably infinite) set G of generators of an abstract C*-algebra A is called hyperrigid if for every faithful representation of A on a Hilbert space $A\subseteq \mathcal B(H)$ and every sequence of unital completely positive linear maps $\phi_1, \phi_2,...$ from $\mathcal B(H)$ to itself,   $$ \lim_{n\to\infty}\|\phi_n(g)-g\|=0, \forall g\in G \implies \lim_{n\to\infty}\|\phi_n(a)-a\|=0, \forall a\in A. $$   We show that one can determine whether a given set G of generators is hyperrigid by examining the noncommutative Choquet boundary of the operator space spanned by $G\cup G^*$. We present a variety of concrete applications and discuss prospects for further development.
author: Arveson, William
title: The noncommutative Choquet boundary II: Hyperrigidity

abstract: Through the lens of non-commutative function theory, we examine a non-selfadjoint variant of the Kadison--Singer problem on extensions of pure states. More precisely, given a unital subspace $M$ of a $C^*$-algebra $B$, we aim to characterize those pure states on $M$ admitting a unique extension to a state on $B$. We find naturally occurring examples where every pure state has this property. In the more structured setting of a subalgebra $A$ of $B$, we shed light on the uniqueness of extensions via the existence of excisions in $A$, in the sense of Akemann--Anderson--Pedersen. Certain non-commutative peak points, both in the state space and in the representation space of $B$, play a crucial role in our analysis. In particular, the question of abundance of non-commutative peak points is addressed.
author: Clouâtre, Raphaël
title: Pure states on operator algebras: excision, extension and peaking

abstract: We investigate various notions of peaking behaviour for states on a $\mathrm{C}^*$-algebra, where the peaking occurs within an operator system. We pay particularly close attention to the existence of sequences of elements forming an approximation of the characteristic function of a point in the state space. We exploit such characteristic sequences to localize the $\mathrm{C}^*$-algebra at a given state, and use this localization procedure to verify a variation of Arveson's hyperrigidity conjecture for arbitrary operator systems.
author: Clouâtre, Raphaël
title: Non-commutative peaking phenomena and a local version of the hyperrigidity conjecture
